doc.previous: The Chester Canal had locks down to the River Dee Canal boats could enter the river at high tide to load goods directly onto seagoing vessels The port facilities at Crane Wharf by Chester racecourse made an important contribution to the commercial development of the north west region citation needed
doc.after: The original Chester Canal was constructed to run from the River Dee near Sealand Road to Nantwich in south Cheshire and opened in 1774 In 1805 the Wirral section of the Ellesmere Canal was opened which ran from Netherpool now known as Ellesmere Port to meet the Chester Canal at Chester canal basin Later those two canal branches became part of the Shropshire Union Canal network This canal which runs beneath the northern section of the city walls of Chester is navigable and remains in use today
